intro: Tetraplasandra munroi, commonly known as the Tongan hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the South Pacific, particularly Tonga and Fiji. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants, and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters, with thick, woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink and red, bloom throughout the year, making it a notable ornamental plant in its native habitat.
